title: Add sweep withdrawal fee for 0x01 validators
description: Imposes a 0.05% fee on partial (“sweep”) withdrawals from 0x01 validators to account for resources and encourage 0x02 migration.
author: Anders Elowsson (@anderselowsson), Toni Wahrstätter (@nerolation), Francesco D'Amato (@fradamt), Ben Adams (@benaadams), Maria Inês Silva (@misilva73)
laymanDescription: Adds a small 0.05% fee when old-style 0x01 validators auto-withdraw extra balance, keeping consolidation and costs fair.

endUsers.description: End users who do not run validators are unaffected; change happens inside protocol accounting for validator sweeps only now implemented.

appDevs.description: Apps are unaffected unless they surface validator sweep amounts and must now display the slightly reduced 0x01 payouts exactly received.

walletDevs.description: The amount credited to the EL will be 0.05% lower than the balance decrease on the CL.

toolingInfra.description: The amount credited to the EL will be 0.05% lower than the balance decrease on the CL.

layer2s.description: L2 systems unaffected by this proposal.

stakersNodes.description: Skimming 0x01 validators will pay 0.05% per sweep and are nudged toward upgrading to 0x02 validator types.

clClients.description: Consensus clients add a constant and arithmetic in process_withdrawals; low complexity but consensus-critical so thorough tests required before Glamsterdam activation.

elClients.description: Execution clients require no code changes. The amount credited to the EL will be 0.05% lower than the balance decrease on the CL.

benefits: Incentivizes validator consolidation required for fast finality.
Let's 0x01 validators pay for the EL workload imposed by the sweep.
Is easy to expand in the future if consolidation remains insufficient.
Can be expanded already today to compensate for 0x02 lower capital efficiency
